page.title: 06Arts and Crafts
page.content: The pottery at Whitely court was started in 1952 by Mr. Loo Groves and Miss Margaret Leach. Both these potters having trained at the St.Ives pottery under Bernard Leach. Margaret left the pottery in 1958 and Mr Groves carried on working until his death. In 1975 when the pottery was taken over by Sean and Vicky Casserly, who both trained at Redruth College of Art in Cornwall. During this time the pottery produced has been slip decorated earthenware. The only changes in equipment has been from kick to electric wheels in 1960. And changes to kilns and fuels used oil in 1950's. Electric from 1963 to 1979, and LPG. Since then, because of the weakness of the local clay. Clay has always been brought in from Stoke_On_Trent, as have glaze materials.
